tips latvian braids are created by twisting the working yarns around each other on round 2 and then twisting them in the opposite direction on round 3 while working round 2 the yarns get more difficult to manage as the twist develops but don t bother untwisting them they will resolve themselves in round 3 one suggestion is to set the balls or skeins of working yarn across the room as you work round 2 to give some distance along which the twists can develop and make it more manageable round 1 join cc2 *k1mc k1cc2 repeat from * until end of round crown round 2 move both yarns to the
